candidates.title: crypto_box v0.9.0
candidates.body:
COMPATIBILITY NOTE: previous versions of this crate provided a `ChaChaBox` construction which is incompatible with the one in libsodium. This release makes breaking changes to that construction which provide compatibility with the libsodium implementation. No backwards compatibility is provided for the construction in previous releases of this crate. We apologize for the inconvenience.

### Added
- `SEALBYTES` constant ([#81])
- `serde` impl for `SecretKey` ([#101])
- Generic implementation of `CryptoBox` ([#113])

### Changed
- Use `crypto_secretbox` crate for symmetric cryptography ([#82], [#109])
- Replaced `x25519-dalek` with `curve25519-dalek` v4; MSRV 1.60 ([#88], [#130])
- Use `MontgomeryPoint` as `PublicKey`'s inner type ([#91])
- Make `seal` and `unseal` inherent methods ([#118])
  - `seal` => `PublicKey::seal`
  - `seal_open` => `SecretKey::unseal`
- Consistent constructors for `PublicKey`/`SecretKey` ([#119])

### Removed
- `rand_core` reexport ([#116])

candidates.title: test-vector-gen: initial `crypto_secretbox` test vectors
candidates.body:
Adds a `publish = false` crate for generating test vectors using libsodium.

Uses the `libsodium-sys-stable` crate, which unlike `sodiumoxide` and `libsodium-sys` is actually maintained (by libsodium's author, no less). This allows the test vectors to be generated once so libsodium isn't a hard dependency for development work.

Unfortunately both the `libsodium-sys` and `libsodium-sys-stable` packages define a `libsodium_sys` crate, so it's not possible to use both in the same project. For that reason this removes the `dev-dependencies` on `sodiumoxide`, with TODOs to refactor the code which previously used `sodiumoxide` into a test vector generator.

It prints out test vector strings for given inputs, using the syntax of the `hex-literal` crate, i.e. `hex!`.

It currently reproduces the existing XSalsa20Poly1305 test vectors (originally extracted from NaCl), and generates new test vectors for the libsodium-flavored XChaCha20Poly1305.

These test vectors are used to test the existing `XChaCha20Poly1305` implementation in `crypto_secretbox`, which passes. It was previously untested (and also unreleased).

candidates.title: crypto_box: generate test vectors with `test-vector-gen`
candidates.body:
Uses the `test-vetctor-gen` crate to generate test vectors for Curve25519XChaCha20Poly1305 using libsodium as a reference.

The test vectors pass with the existing implementation, indicating the old test vectors were bogus.

candidates.title: crypto_box: use `crypto_secretbox`
candidates.body: Switches to using the `crypto_secretbox` crate for implementing `crypto_box`, which allows for a generic implementation that can be shared between Salsa20 and ChaCha20-based boxes.

candidates.title: crypto_secretbox: use `Salsa20` and `ChaCha20Legacy`
candidates.body:
Previously this was using the IETF variant of ChaCha20, but for compatibility with e.g. libsodium we need to use the original DJB variant.

This also changes to using the `Salsa20` (as opposed to `XSalsa20`) type and using the `Kdf` trait to impl both `XSalsa20` and `XChaCha20`, since the `chacha20` version of `XChaCha20` is built on the IETF variant of `ChaCha20` (so as to be compatible with draft-irtf-cfrg-xchacha).

candidates.title: crypto_secretbox: add `chacha20` feature
candidates.body:
Adds `chacha20` feature providing a `XChaCha20Poly1305` type alias.

Note that this construction of "XChaCha20Poly1305" is different from the one implemented by the `chacha20poly1305` crate, which implements constructions based on the IETF variant of ChaCha20Poly1305.

The flavor of `XChaCha20Poly1305` in this crate is based on pre-IETF constructions and is only supported by libsodium.

This is an unfortunate state of affairs to have two incompatible constructions with the same name. One of the original goals of `draft-irtf-cfrg-xchacha` was to ensure that "XChaCha20" was always based on the IETF variant of ChaCha20.

The `AEAD_XChaCha20_Poly1305` construction that I-D defines is only compatible with the version implemented by the `chacha20poly1305` crate, and is *INCOMPATIBLE* with the construction provided by this crate, which lacks features like AAD and is therefore not a full AEAD mode.

Comments to this effect have been left on the `XChaCha20Poly1305` type definition in this crate.

candidates.title: crypto_secretbox: make `salsa20` an optional dependency
candidates.body: The intent is to allow using it with `chacha20` exclusively if desired.

candidates.title: Use `doc_auto_cfg`
candidates.body: Replace manual `doc(cfg(...))` annotations with automatic documentation generation.

candidates.title: crypto_box: use `crypto_secretbox`
candidates.body:
Sources `XSalsa20Poly1305` from `crypto_secretbox` instead of the `xsalsa20poly1305` crate.

The longer-term goal is to make `XSalsa20Poly1305` generic around the stream cipher.

candidates.title: crypto_secretbox: import from `xsalsa20poly1305`
candidates.body:
libsodium supports a flavor of XChaCha20Poly1305 which is based on the legacy djb construction. For compatibility with that we need to make the `XSalsa20Poly1305` construction from the [`xsalsa20poly1305` crate](https://github.com/RustCrypto/AEADs/tree/57956bf2d8273e7b3fddd127aa7116ad5ef1c5ad/xsalsa20poly1305) generic around the underlying stream cipher.

This commit begins that work by importing the crate from the `AEADs` repository, making minimal changes to documentation and test names to reflect the new `crypto_secretbox` crate name.

It can be made generic in a followup commit.

candidates.title: crypto_box: Add optional serde support
candidates.body:
The `serde` feature is optional, but enabled by default. (Could be made off-by-default if desired, not sure if we have a batteries-included or a minimal-by-default policy here.)

I used the serde-crate-alias trick, inspired by https://github.com/RustCrypto/RSA/pull/41

For a round-trip serialization test, I added "bincode" and "rand" dev-dependencies.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [x25519-dalek](https://github.com/dalek-cryptography/x25519-dalek) from 1.1.1 to 1.2.0.
Changelog

Sourced from x25519-dalek's changelog.

Changelog

Entries are listed in reverse chronological order.

1.x Series

1.2

  • Add module documentation for using the bytes-oriented x25519() API.
  • Add implementation of zeroize::Zeroize for PublicKey.
  • Move unittests to a separate directory.
  • Add cargo feature flags "fiat_u32_backend" and "fiat_u64_backend" for activating the Fiat crypto field element implementations.
  • Fix issue with removed feature(external_doc) on nightly compilers.
  • Pin zeroize to version 1.3 to support a wider range of MSRVs.
  • Add CI via Github actions.
  • Fix breakage in the serde unittests.
  • MSRV is now 1.41 for production and 1.48 for development.
  • Add an optional check to SharedSecret for contibutory behaviour.
  • Add implementation of ReusableSecret keys which are non-ephemeral, but which cannot be serialised to discourage long-term use.
